title: Dog faced being put down for biting boy while trying to save his life after his mother tried to drown him
text:
This is the dog involved in the terrible incident at #Moama . Owner says he was trying to save 9yo in river, not hurt him @9NewsMelb pic.twitter.com/v5J14aAzxp 
— Laura Spurway (@laura_spurway) March 3, 2017 

A pitbull has been saved from being put down after it was revealed he bit a boy while saving his life.
Buddy was actually helping the nine-year-old out of a river after his mother allegedly tried to drown him in a river in Moama, New South Wales.
NutriBullet users show horrific injuries caused by 'exploding blenders' Police said the dog will now be reunited with his owners after finding that he ‘was acting in reasonable defence of the nine-year-old boy.’
The boy’s mother, 27, allegedly killed his five-year-old’s brother and was trying to drown him as well Murray River.
She has been charged with murder and attempted murder while the nine-year-old is being treated for dog bites at the Royal Children’s hospital.
The owner of the dog started a petition to prevent his dog from being put down. They said: ‘Buddy the dog has reacted and attempted to save the boys in doing so he has bit the eldest boy in his rescue attempts, unfortunately he was unable to save the youngest boy and has also bit the mother.
‘Buddy is a member of our family and has grown up around children his whole life and has been the most gentlest dog, he has clearly seen a child in distress and attempted to help.’
People are fascinated by this clip of Donald Trump's wayward hair The boy’s grandfather has supported the petition saying he owns a similar dog so understands their nature.
Margot Stork, from the Murray River Council which seized the dog, said: ‘The NSW Police have since advised us that their investigations to date have deemed that the dog in question was responding to extreme circumstances and it is likely that the dog was acting in reasonable defence of the nine year old boy that was subsequently hospitalised.
‘The NSW Police have advised council that they will not be seeking an order to destroy this animal.
‘Since the incident, we have micro-chipped the dog and are working with the dog’s owner to register the dog and set up the appropriate conditions to enable the dog to return home.’
The boys’ father has started a gofundme page to try and get to the boys to be with his nine-year-old son.
